meanings.definition: People who commit something to memory.
meanings.sent1: The memorizers in the class always knew the answers to the questions.
meanings.sent2: The students were excellent memorizers and aced the test.
meanings.sent3: The memorizers at the spelling bee were like walking dictionaries!
meanings.sent4: Her brain worked like a supercharged memorizer, never forgetting a detail.
meanings.sent5: The memorizers in the group study session made learning seem effortless.

meanings.definition: Those who remember or retain information through memorization.
meanings.sent1: The memorizers quickly recalled the historical dates during the quiz.
meanings.sent2: She was one of the best memorizers in the team, always ready with facts.
meanings.sent3: The memorizers at the trivia night were unstoppable, winning every round.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vault, a memorizer of all the facts he encountered.
meanings.sent5: The memorizers amazed everyone with their ability to remember complex formulas.
